title: Gamplay Blitz vs Ezreal
body: I have experienced this bug several times. As the animation of Blitz pull is pulling Ezreal to him (he is caught ) Ezreal can escape from the pull with his blink. Not only does he escape the blink takes him a few feet from he was originally pull--meaning he has blinked away not a regular blink distance, but from the original positioned he was pulled. There have been times I have pulled him from maxed distance and have him almost too me, the he blinks back to that maxes distance and then some.  This is repeatable as Ezreal is the only adc that doesn't need to fear of being pulled by Blitz.

replies.body:
In this specific interaction, it is functioning as intended
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/1M7U5VkZ-blitzcrank-pull-nullified-by-ezreal-arcane-shift?comment=0002

Is this not working as intended with shaco then? Because I play a lot of shaco and it is frustrating that other blinks/leaps allow champions to get away from blitz right before he follows up on his pull but shaco gets hit by the knock up and cant blink away nor can he ult. It might just be because I have 80 ping since the server move though...

Its the cast time that takes so long to finish the spell 
unlike a channel, a cast time cant be interrupted by cc, it can only be interrupted via death
shaco's q has almost no cast time
you can see the cast time of an ability under your champion and little above your hud (a blue bar appears where the name of the spell is written and either the bar is getting filled or its getting empty)
also a good example is ezreals ult
it seems like a channel but again its just a cast time 
so only death would stop him from ulting

No offense, but I do believe that there is some clunkyness in that interaction, because the distance Ezreal can blink depends on the **angle** between Blitz's pull and Ezreal's blink.

Sadly, a little schema would be best, but I've nothing available to draw right now, so I'll give you repro steps instead.

1. Get Ezreal at roughly Blitz pull's max range
2. Get Blitz to fire its pull, and at roughly the same time...
3a. ... get Ez to blink **directly away** from Blitz
3b. ... get Ez to blink **perpendicularly** from Blitz pull

In case b., Ez re-appears at the exact position he would have been even if he hadn't been grabbed at all. Whereas in case a., he kinda "escapes" the pull, but he still loses some distance compared to the original target point. This is not consistent.

It's kinda hard to explain, but just test what I told a few times and you should see by yourself what I'm talking about. ;)

Hope that helps.
